item.title: Thanksgiving series: Homemade Apple pie
item.description: 1. use a simple combo of different apples, I like using braeburn, honey crisp and 1 granny smith. this adds some different apple flavors 2. brown sugar adds a really nice molasses-y hint of flavor 3. all-purpose flour vs. cornstarch is great because apples aren’t as juicy as berries so they don’t need it. 4. I love adding creme fraiche or sour cream. as it bakes, it makes a caramel-like sauce and it’s DELICIOUS. 5. bake it until it’s bubbly and the crust is visibly golden brown. we don’t like underbaked pies. 6. use a metal pie pan. i used to be a glass pie pan girl and i have long since changed my tune. they bake faster and are much easier to stick in the freezer if need be!

item.title: Thanksgiving series: French Onion Rolls
item.description: They are amazing, These are filled with caramelized onions and delicious melty gruyere cheese.

item.title: Homemade cranberry sauce
item.description: My favorite part of thanksgiving. Here's the recipe: 1 (12-ounce) bag cranberries 1/4 cup white sugar 1/4 cup brown sugar 1 cinnamon stick 1/4 tsp kosher salt 1 tsp vanilla 1 tsp orange zest 1/2 tsp grated fresh ginger 1/2 cup water Juice from 1 orange

item.title: Jalapeño Cheddar Cornbread
item.description: The perfect combination of a teeny bit sweet and spicy and cheesy. The best combination. It’s so delicious when served piping hot with scallion butter.

item.title: Weekend baking vibes: easy apple cheese danish
item.description: A simple, cozy recipe that blends flaky pastry, creamy cheese, and warm apple filling, perfect for effortless weekend baking.
